title: 'They Never Offered Me Counseling': De-Transitioned Woman Details Irreversible Side Effects Of Transitioning As A Minor
description:
Texas is currently weighing a bill that would prevent "experimental sex change" surgeries from being performed as minors. Y'know, that thing we've been assured never happens ever in America and is just a right-wing nut-job conspiracy theory. Except they need a law to ban it.

Anywho, a detransitioned woman named Prisha Mosley testified before the Texas Senate Health Committee about her transition as a minor. At the time, she had already been diagnosed with anorexia, borderline personality disorder, and trauma disorder. She said her therapist told her a sex change would cure her. (Note: if hearing this makes your blood boil - you're not alone.)

She was also sexually assaulted at 14 and thought she would be "safe" from future assaults if she was no longer a girl.

None
— (@)

"What I don’t understand is why they never offered me counseling, to help me with the depression, the trauma, the personality disorder, or my ongoing self harm.”

She started taking testosterone at 17, which caused her to lose hair on her head and grow it everywhere else on her body. It also made her shoulders broaden, causing her a great deal of pain. Her voice is permanently deeper, her hormones can no longer regulate themselves, and she has vaginal atrophy so severe she can no longer use a tampon. Oh, and she had a double mastectomy.

This growing trend of doctors prescribing radical gender transition surgeries for mental health issues should concern everyone, regardless of political affiliation. It should be considered medical malpractice and the doctors responsible should have their licenses taken away. It's also infuriating to hear the other side argue that kids can just "try out" hormones for a while. These side effects experienced by Mosley are not irreversible. You cannot undo years of testosterone on a prepubescent female body. You cannot undo a double mastectomy.

Hopefully, more states will join Texas in weighing complete bans on such procedures. It's the only way.

title: Breaking: Trump claims he'll be arrested next week, calls on supporters to protest
description:
Ladies and gents, we may just see a perp walk of Donald Trump. For realz.

For some context: Trump is currently being investigated by the Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg for alleged hush money payments Trump made as a presidential candidate in 2016. AKA, porn star Stormy Daniels.

Trump posted the news of his apparently imminent arrest on Truth Social: "NOW ILLEGAL LEAKS FROM A CORRUPT & HIGHLY POLITICAL MANHATTAN DISTRICT ATTORNEYS OFFICE, WHICH HAS ALLOWED NEW RECORDS TO BE SET IN VIOLENT CRIME & WHOSE LEADER IS FUNDED BY GEORGE SOROS, INDICATE THAT, WITH NO CRIME BEING ABLE TO BE PROVEN, & BASED ON AN OLD & FULLY DEBUNKED (BY NUMEROUS OTHER PROSECUTORS!) FAIRYTALE, THE FAR & AWAY LEADING REPUBLICAN CANDIDATE & FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WILL BE ARRESTED ON TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK. PROTEST, TAKE OUR NATION BACK!"

None
— (@)

Trump also called for his supporters to protest to take our nation back!”

In a statement to Fox News Digital, Trump spokesperson Steven Cheung said: "President Donald J. Trump is completely innocent, he did nothing wrong, and even the biggest, most Radical Left Democrats are making that clear." The Manhattan District Attorney's office would neither "confirm or comment" to Fox on the impending indictment.

I would argue that Trump did do something wrong, at least morally, if he did in fact have an affair with Stormy Daniels. But I'm not sure what the charges would be in terms of state law. Apparently, Bragg is focusing on whether Trump committed a crime by disguising a $130,000 payment to Stormy Daniels as a legal expense rather than as an expenditure to boost his presidential campaign.

The sheer volume of investigations into Donald Trump - this one, the Georgia election, the Mar-a-Lago raid- do suggest this is a witch hunt. They're trying to get him on anything. And if they do, they'll just martyr him even further. Even Elon Musk thinks so:

None
— (@)

So I guess we'll just wait and see what Tuesday will bring. Could be an, er, exciting week/month/year ahead.

title: White college professor declares keeping a neat and tidy pantry is -- you guessed it -- racist AF
description:
The word "literally" is often misused. But I think at this point we can say there literally nothing that some woke white "academic" won't claim is raaaaaaciat. Today, it's your pantry. If you keep it neat and brag about doing so on the TikTok, you are an opressor. So sayeth Loyola University professor Jenna Drenten, a white woman who puts her pronouns in her bio.

Drenten is so distraught and has so much sand in her whatever over this brand of social media content, she is lashing out about it. And I quote:

Storing spices in coordinated glass jars and color-coordinating dozens of sprinkles containers may seem trivial. But tidiness is tangled up with status, and messiness is loaded with assumptions about personal responsibility and respectability.

Cleanliness has historically been used as a cultural gatekeeping mechanism to reinforce status distinctions based on a vague understanding of ‘niceness’: nice people, with nice yards, in nice houses, make for nice neighborhoods.

Here comes the boom:

What lies beneath the surface of this anti-messiness, pro-niceness stance is a history of classist, racist and sexist social structures.

Sexist too! Women sharing content about their pantries is sexist! And I guess so sexist, they don't realize how sexist they are being. Racistly sexist. Or maybe it's Sexistly racist.

Here is the content that Jenna won't calm down about. It's called "pantry porn." People take pride in organizing their pantries and share that pride on TikTok. Sometimes it is set to a song I'm sure Jenna would consider to be cultural appropriation.

@little_label_co Pantry Goals 🔥 #pantrygoals #pantry #pantryporn #pantryinspo #littlelabelco ♬ Pon De Replay - Ed Marquis & Emie

Others go the more ASMR route.

@andreanava.7 Pantry and Fridge Restock #pantryorganization #asmr #pantryasmr #organizewithme #satisfying #organizedhome #pantrygoals #foryou #fyp ♬ original sound - Andrea

What this is all about if I were to venture a guess? Jenna is either a slob and can't maintain a neat pantry herself. Or she is bitter about her life choices and can't stand to see people on social media who are happy with theirs.

Calling something sexist racism was just the easiest way to for her to get published.

title: Watch: Ron DeSantis drops the mic on freedom and fighting culture wars in under sixty seconds
description:
As of me writing this sentence, America's Governor Ron DeSantis has not announced he is running for president. Conservatives want him to. Congressman Chip Roy seems to think he's going to. But as of this morning, he's just a Florida man on a book tour and doing interviews for his book.

SHOULD DeSantis decide to run, this clip from Glenn Beck summarizes why and what the national debate needs to be in under sixty seconds.

Ron DeSantis: “We’re creating a model for what a free society should be. Yes: freedom for you to not be constrained by government—all conservatives have always believed that—but also, freedom for you to live your life without having the pathologies of the Left imposed upon you… https://t.co/rWZHrkqZq8 pic.twitter.com/xFiXZMCOpg
— Catch Up (@CatchUpNetwork) March 17, 2023

All conservatives believe in living free from government constraints. That's the barest minimum you need to believe to consider yourself a conservative. But as DeSantis explains, it doesn't end there. "But also freedom for you to live your life without having the pathologies of the left imposed on you from all the other institutions in society. And maybe that's a woke corporation. Maybe that's [George] Soros funds a [district attorney} in your community and then this DA says he's not enforcing the law, putting your family at risk."

Not unlike the Soros-funded DA that DeSantis removed from office for not enforcing the law and putting Florida families at risk.

DeSantis continued, "You have to recognize that the threats to freedom are more than whether or not someone is going to come in and raise your taxes or pass a bad piece of legislation. I think Florida, we're fighting full spectrum. I think more conservatives across the country are recognizing we need to fight full spectrum."

Let THIS be what the 2024 campaign is about. And hell, take Joe Biden out of the equation. Replace him with Gavin Newsom. Make it a level playing field. Two young governors (younger than boomers, at least) representing polar opposite ideologies, crisscrossing the country and making the case to the American people.

If DeSsntis makes THIS case, we win.

title: "Why all the hate for people?": GOP Senator puts on masterclass in confronting reporter before the interview even starts
description:
This, my friends, is how it's done. If you are Republican Senator Josh Hawley and sitting down for an interview, you know you aren't getting any serious questions on anything you've done between January 7th, 2021 and March 17th, 2023. If reporters want to play journactivists and aren't smart enough to keep their disdain for Americans off of Twitter, Hawley is ready to play.

The Missouri (or Missoura) senator sat down with KSDK-TV's Mark Maxwell started the interview with a question of his own.

LOL: Senator @HawleyMO confronts left wing reporter who had an VERY public meltdown about @elonmusk.

"You also said that you didn't necessarily do any of this sober...I hope you do our interview sober!" pic.twitter.com/jOwyFbtAma
— Townhall.com (@townhallcom) March 17, 2023

"I gotta ask you, why all the hate for people who like free speech on Twitter? What's going on with that? You called people who liked Elon Musk buying the site Twitter a bunch of 'boot-lickers.' This was on March 6. I'm looking at it right here. Seems kind of vitriolic."

Maxwell attempted to explain he had sand in his vag when Twitter wasn't working well one night, and there were a lot of tweeps with a "cultish adoration" for Elon in his menchies that put him in a bad mood.

But Sen. Hawley wasn't done.

"You also said that you didn't necessarily do any of this sober...I hope you do our interview sober!"

Dude.

If you are any Republican other than Larry Hogan and a reporter is interviewing you, anticipate it's going to be adversarial and anticipate the reporter will claim they are "unbiased." So lay out the terms of the debate yourself.

The reporter is biased towards the left. Here is evidence of the reporter being biased toward the left...because the reporter DOESN'T HIDE IT. And now that all cards are on the table, let's discuss the issues.

Well done, Sen. Hawley. Well done.
